post_excerpt: Fluffy, pan-fried fritters with tuna and rice. They go well with any combination of sides from steamed veggies to packet pastas.
post_content:
Fluffy, pan-fried fritters with tuna and rice. They go well with any combination of sides from steamed veggies to packet pastas.

Ingredients

¾ cup rice 1 (425g) tin of tuna, drained 1 medium onion, chopped ¼ cup milk 2 eggs, separated 2 tbsp flour 1 tsp sugar 1 tsp vinegar 1 tbsp parsley, chopped ½ tsp salt ¼ tsp pepper

Steps

  1. Cook the rice in boiling salted water for 12 minutes; drain.
  2. Combine the rice, drained tuna, chopped onion, milk, flour, sugar, vinegar, parsley, salt and pepper.
  3. Separate the eggs and add the yolks to the mixture.
  4. Beat the egg whites until soft peaks form, then fold into the mixture.
  5. Scoop heaped tablespoons of the mixture into a hot oiled pan and fry for five minutes or until golden. Flip each fritter and fry for a further five minutes.

Serving Suggestion

Dipped in tomato sauce, served alongside steamed or roasted veggies. Be quick though, they won't last long. At the dinner table there is only the quick and the hungry!

post_excerpt: Why buy take out when you can make your own fried rice? You can even easily sub-in your own choice of veggies and protein.
post_content:
Why buy take out when you can make your own fried rice? You can even easily sub-in your own choice of veggies and protein.

Ingredients

1 ½ cups plain white rice 1 onion, chopped 1 carrot, chopped Handful of mushrooms, chopped Handful of sliced ham, chopped Half a red capsicum, chopped 2 eggs, beaten ½ teaspoon Chinese five spice 1 tbsp chicken stock 2 tsp sesame oil 1 tbsp soy sauce

Steps

  1. Wash and steam rice.
  2. Pour eggs into hot frypan and cook until set, then chop into pieces and put aside with the other chopped ingredients.
  3. Add the onions and carrots to the frypan and cook for one minute. Add the rest of the vegetables and continue to cook.
  4. Once the vegetables have cooked through, add the chopped egg and steamed rice into the frypan and mix thoroughly.
  5. Add sesame oil, soy sauce, chicken stock and Chinese five spice.

Serving Suggestion

This is a great recipe for using up whatever is in the kitchen pantry. Try substituting the ham with salami or Chinese sausage, or adding peas or chopped spring onion. Best served with a dash of extra soy sauce and some pan fried gyoza.

post_excerpt: Hearty, herby meatballs simmered in a tomato sauce and best served on a bed of hot fluffy mashed potato. The perfect Winter warmer!
post_content:
Hearty, herby meatballs simmered in a tomato sauce and best served on a bed of hot fluffy mashed potato. The perfect Winter warmer!

Ingredients

Meatballs

500g good quality beef mince ½ cup fresh multigrain breadcrumbs ½ cup raw rice - use basmati for lower GI 1 large onion, finely chopped 1 clove garlic, finely chopped 1 egg 1 tbsp dried mixed herbs (fresh if you have them) -- basil, oregano & parsley 1 tbsp tomato sauce

Sauce

Worcestershire sauce Salt & pepper Large can tomato soup and ½ can water

Steps

  1. Combine all meatball ingredients and mix well. Use your hands to massage well as they will stick together much better that way. Shape into balls the size of walnuts. Place in layers in casserole dish.
  2. Cover with soup & water and a few good shakes of Worcestershire sauce. Cover and simmer for at least 45 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
  3. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Serving Suggestion

Serve in a bowl with a generous amount of mashed potato.

post_excerpt: The meatloaf of meatloaves – perfectly seasoned beef slow cooked in the oven for over an hour, regularly glazed for a rich and slightly spicy outer layer.
post_content:
The meatloaf of meatloaves – perfectly seasoned beef slow cooked in the oven for over an hour, regularly glazed for a rich and slightly spicy outer layer.

Ingredients

Meatloaf

1 kg beef mince 1 cup breadcrumbs 1 large onion 2 eggs, beaten ½ cup water ½ cup milk 2 tsp curry powder 1 cup oats 2 tbsp parsley (dry or fresh) Salt & pepper

Sauce

¾ cup water ½ cup Worcestershire sauce 3 tsp vinegar 3 tsp lemon juice ½ cup tomato sauce 1 tbsp butter, melted

Steps

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C (fan forced).
  2. Combine meat, breadcrumbs, onion, oats, curry powder, salt, pepper and eggs together in a large bowl. Add milk and water. Place in a large baking tray/dish.
  3. Combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and pour over meat. Baste occasionally.
  4. Cook for about one hour or until cooked through.

Serving Suggestion

You can add any kind of vegetables to the meatloaf to mix things up. The recipe can be easily halved to make a smaller meatloaf for 2-3 people. Best served with mashed potatoes and veggies.

post_content:
Perfect for breakfast or dessert (or just because!), fluffy, golden pancakes should be a staple in everyone’s cooking repertoire.

Ingredients

2 cups self-raising flour 1/3 cup sugar Pinch of salt 2 cups milk 2 eggs, separated

Steps

  1. Combine all dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
  2. In a separate mixing bowl, beat the egg yolks and then add the milk. Once combined, add the mixture into the dry ingredients and mix well with a whisk.
  3. Beat the egg whites with an electric beater until stiff white peaks form, then fold the whites into the batter.
  4. Heat a frying pan to a warm temperature (less than half) and melt a small amount of butter to grease the pan. Pour small amounts of the batter into the pan and fry until bubbles rise to the tops, then flip over and cook until golden brown.

Serving Suggestion

Oven-roasted pumpkin, baby spinach and toasted pine nuts, all dressed gently in a honey and balsamic glaze.
post_content:
Oven-roasted pumpkin, baby spinach and toasted pine nuts, all dressed gently in a honey and balsamic glaze.

Ingredients

Salad

1.75kg butternut pumpkin, descended, cut into 2cm thick pieces Olive oil cooking spray 1/2 cup pine nuts 200g baby spinach

Dressing

1/4 cup honey 2 tbsp balsamic vinegar 1 tbsp olive oil

Steps

  1. Preheat oven to 200°C. Line two baking trays with baking paper. Place pumpkin in a single layer on trays. Spray with oil and turn to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Roast pumpkin, turning once, for twenty minutes or until golden and tender. Set aside to cool to room temperature.
  2. Meanwhile, heat a small, non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add pine nuts. Cook, stirring, for three minutes or until golden.
  3. Make honey and balsamic dressing: Combine honey, vinegar and oil in a screw-top jar. Secure lid and shake to combine. Remove lid. Microwave on high (100%) for ten seconds or until honey is melted. Replace lid. Shake until well combined.
  4. Place spinach and pumpkin in a large bowl. Sprinkle with pine nuts. Drizzle with dressing. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

post_excerpt: There’s no better burger than a homemade burger. They’re never dry, never break apart when cooking on the grill, they’re simply fresh and delicious.
post_content:
There’s no better burger than a homemade burger. They’re never dry, never break apart when cooking on the grill, they’re simply fresh and delicious.

Ingredients

500g beef mince 1 onion, finely chopped 1 carrot, finely chopped 1 apple, finely chopped 2 eggs 2 slices of bread 2 tbsp soy sauce 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce ½ cup tomato sauce 2 tsp Vegeta vegetable stock

Steps

  1. Peel the apple, carrot and onion.
  2. Blend the apple, carrot, onion and bread separately in a food processor.
  3. Combine all ingredients by hand in a large mixing bowl. Make sure you mix everything thoroughly, otherwise they’ll fall apart when you cook them!
  4. Break off a small handful of the mixture and roll it into a ball. Set aside on a plate and repeat until all of the mixture is used.
  5. Fry them off either on the barbeque or a frying pan with a generous amount of olive oil.

Serving Suggestion

So good you can eat them on their own with a dab of tomato sauce. Alternatively
meta_key: throw them in a toasted bun with your favourite burger condiments."

post_excerpt: Chocolate fudge in five minutes with only three ingredients? So yum you won’t want to share!
post_content:
Chocolate fudge in five minutes with only three ingredients? So yum you won’t want to share!

Ingredients

60g unsalted cooking butter 375g chocolate melts 1 tin condensed milk

Steps

  1. Add all ingredients to a microwave safe container and microwave for three minutes.
  2. Stir mixture using a metal spoon until combined and pour into a flat tray lined with baking paper.
  3. Refrigerate until completely set and cold to touch.
  4. Remove fudge from the tray and cut into 4cm cubes. Store in refrigerator in a sealed container.

Serving Suggestion

I suggest you eat them quickly before someone else does!

post_excerpt: Mild or super spicy? However you like it, this is an easy pasta dish you can throw together quickly, and devour slowly.
post_content:
Mild or super spicy? However you like it, this is an easy pasta dish you can throw together quickly, and devour slowly.

Ingredients

250g chicken breast, diced spring onion, finely chopped 500ml cooking cream 2 tbsp (heaped) Sharwood's Tandoori Paste ½ tsp salt 375g fettuccine pasta

Steps

  1. Set a large pot of water on the stove on a high heat to boil.
  2. In a separate pot, add the chicken, tandoori paste and a dash of olive oil and mix thoroughly. Once combined, cook on a high heat until the chicken has cooked through.
  3. Add the cooking cream, salt and a handful of spring onion. Stir and simmer for 10 minutes.
  4. Add the fettuccine to the boiling water and cook per the packet’s instructions. Drain the pasta and combine with the tandoori chicken.

Serving Suggestion

Garnish with shaved parmesan and freshly chopped spring onion and serve with a side of roti bread.
"

post_excerpt: No rubbing the butter into the flour, no lemonade; this foolproof recipe makes perfect scones every time.
post_content:
No rubbing the butter into the flour, no lemonade; this foolproof recipe makes perfect scones every time.

Ingredients

4 cups self-raising flour, sifted ½ tsp salt 1 cup pouring cream 375ml-400ml (or 1½ cups) milk Double cream and raspberry jam to serve

Steps

  1. Preheat fan-forced oven to 230°C. Lightly grease large flat oven tray.
  2. Combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Add cream and 375ml milk. Use a flat-bladed knife to stir to a soft dough adding more milk if necessary. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently until dough comes together.
  3. Press dough out to 2cm-thick. Using a 5.5cm round scone cutter, cut as many scones from dough as possible. Press dough scraps together gently, rolling it 2.5cm-thick and cut more scones. Repeat rolling the dough 5mm thicker each time until you have used all the dough. Place onto tray just touching each other.
  4. Bake for 12-15 minutes until golden and well risen. Serve hot with cream and jam.

Serving Suggestion

Cut in half and topped generously with raspberry jam and whipped thickened cream.

post_excerpt: This easy, savoury slice is the perfect way to incorporate more vegetables into your meal. The tasty egg, bacon and cheese will keep the kids coming back for more.
post_content:
This easy, savoury slice is the perfect way to incorporate more vegetables into your meal. The tasty egg, bacon and cheese will keep the kids coming back for more.

Ingredients

5 eggs 1 cup self-raising flour, sifted 375g zucchini, grated 1 large onion, finely chopped 1 large carrot, grated 2 tsp minced garlic ½ cup frozen corn kernels 200g rindless bacon, chopped 1 cup grated cheddar cheese ½ tsp paprika ¼ cup vegetable oil

Steps

  1. Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease and line a 30 x 20cm lamington pan.
  2. Beat the eggs in a large bowl until combined. Add the flour and beat until smooth, then add zucchini, onion, carrot, corn, garlic, bacon, cheese and oil and stir to combine.
  3. Pour into the prepared pan, sprinkle the top with paprika and bake in oven for 30 minutes or until cooked through and golden on top.

Serving Suggestion

Best eaten warm. Perfect for kids lunchboxes or as a healthy party food option.

post_excerpt: Long remembered as “In the Mex” or the “Tortilla Stack”, this is the one you’ve been waiting for! This delicious dollar-saver recipe is as easy as pie to make – ándale!
post_content:
Long remembered as “In the Mex” or the “Tortilla Stack”, this is the one you’ve been waiting for! This delicious dollar-saver recipe is as easy as pie to make – ándale!

Ingredients

2 tsp olive oil 1 large red onion, finely chopped 2 garlic cloves, crushed 500g beef mince 1 small red capsicum, finely chopped 125g can corn kernels, drained, rinsed 2 tsp Mexican chilli powder 415g can diced tomatoes ½ cup torn fresh coriander leaves 4 salsa-flavoured tortillas 1½ cups grated tasty cheese 1 large tomato, deseeded, finely chopped

Steps

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Reserve two tablespoons of onion. Add garlic and remaining onion to pan. Cook, stirring, for three minutes or until soft. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for eight minutes or until browned.
  2. Add capsicum, corn and chilli powder. Cook, stir, for three minutes or until capsicum is just tender. Stir in diced tomatoes. Reduce head to medium. Simmer, stirring, for five minutes or until mixture is thick. Add half the coriander. Season with salt. Stir to combine. Set aside for ten minutes to cool.
  3. Place a 6cm deep 20cm round springform pan on a baking tray. Place one tortilla in the base of pan. Spread 1/3 of the mince mixture over tortilla. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup of cheese. Repeat layers twice with remaining tortillas, mince mixture and cheese, finishing with one tortilla. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
  4. Bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is golden. Set aside for five minutes before removing from pan.
  5. Meanwhile, to make the salsa, combine chopped tomato, reserved onion and coriander in a bowl.

Serving Suggestion

Serve with a spoonful of salsa and a cerveza for the adults!

2 tsp olive oil 1 large red onion, finely chopped 2 garlic cloves, crushed 500g beef mince 1 small red capsicum, finely chopped 125g can corn kernels, drained, rinsed 2 tsp Mexican chilli powder 415g can diced tomatoes ½ cup torn fresh coriander leaves 4 salsa-flavoured tortillas 1½ cups grated tasty cheese 1 large tomato, deseeded, finely chopped

Steps

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Reserve two tablespoons of onion. Add garlic and remaining onion to pan. Cook, stirring, for three minutes or until soft. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for eight minutes or until browned.
  2. Add capsicum, corn and chilli powder. Cook, stir, for three minutes or until capsicum is just tender. Stir in diced tomatoes. Reduce head to medium. Simmer, stirring, for five minutes or until mixture is thick. Add half the coriander. Season with salt. Stir to combine. Set aside for ten minutes to cool.
  3. Place a 6cm deep 20cm round springform pan on a baking tray. Place one tortilla in the base of pan. Spread 1/3 of the mince mixture over tortilla. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup of cheese. Repeat layers twice with remaining tortillas, mince mixture and cheese, finishing with one tortilla. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
  4. Bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is golden. Set aside for five minutes before removing from pan.
  5. Meanwhile, to make the salsa, combine chopped tomato, reserved onion and coriander in a bowl.

Serving Suggestion

Serve with a spoonful of salsa and a cerveza for the adults!

This chocolate cake recipe is perfect for afternoon tea (or just because!).

Ingredients

1 cup of self raising flour, sifted ⅓ cup of cocoa powder, sifted 1 cup of caster sugar ⅓ cup of butter, softened ½ cup of milk 2 eggs, lightly beaten

Steps

  1. Preheat the fan forced oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
  2. Grease your pan with butter and line it with baking paper.
  3. In a large mixing boll whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, eggs, sugar, milk and the butter. You can use an electric mixer on high for four minutes.
  4. Pour your batter into the lined pan and smooth out the batter with a spatula.
  5. Put the pan into the oven for 35-40 minutes. The cake is ready when you can poke a toothpick into the cake and it comes out clean.

Serving Suggestion

Best eaten warm with some vanilla ice cream.

Ingredients

2 tbsp vegetable oil 8 chicken thigh fillets, trimmed and chopped 1 leek, trimmed and sliced 2 garlic cloves, crushed 1 tbsp chopped rosemary leaves 1/4 cup plain flour, sifted 1 1/2 cups chicken stock 1/2 cup pouring cream 1 cup frozen peas 2 sheets of puff pastry 1 egg, lightly beaten

Steps

  1. Preheat the oven to 220deg.
  2. Heat oil in large frying pan over a high heat. Cook chicken until browned.
  3. Add the leek, garlic and rosemary and cook for 2-3 minutes or until softened.
  4. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute.
  5. Add the stock and cream and cook, stirring for a further 5 minutes or until thickened.
  6. Allow to cool slightly and stir through the peas.
  7. Spoon mixture into ramekin dished. Place pastry on top of the mixture , brush with egg and bake for 15-20 minutes until pastry is puffed and golden.
Makes 4 pies
